class apis.inference.online.api.OnlineInference

Bases: BaseAPI

Wraps API methods for handling requests.

Methods:

root(item: Item): Handles POST requests to the root endpoint with JSON body.

Methods

all_data_sources_reachable()

This api does not use data sources.

health_check()

Handles POST requests to the root endpoint.

collect_health_data

favicon
all_data_sources_reachable() → Tuple[int, str]

This api does not use data sources.

Returns:
tuple[int, str]: A tuple containing an HTTP status code and a message.

The status code indicates the result of the operation. The message provides additional details about the status.

async health_check()

Handles POST requests to the root endpoint.

Returns:

Response: A message confirming the received item.

class apis.toolbox.api_constructs.BaseAPI

Bases: ABC

Methods

all_data_sources_reachable()

Check if all data sources are reachable.

collect_health_data

favicon
abstract all_data_sources_reachable() → Tuple[int, str]

Check if all data sources are reachable. If one fails, return (503, f’{failed_source_name}: error message’)

Returns:
tuple[int, str]: A tuple containing an HTTP status code and a message.

The status code indicates the result of the operation. The message provides additional details about the status.

collect_health_data() → ServiceHealth

class apis.toolbox.api_models.Item(*, name: str, description: str = None, price: float, tax: float = None)

Bases: BaseModel

Represents an item in the inventory.

Attributes:

name (str): The name of the item. description (str, optional): The description of the item (default is None). price (float): The price of the item. tax (float, optional): The tax rate for the item (default is None).

Attributes:
model_extra

Get extra fields set during validation.

model_fields_set

Returns the set of fields that have been explicitly set on this model instance.

model_computed_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, ComputedFieldInfo]] = {}

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'description': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=False), 'name': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'price': FieldInfo(annotation=float, required=True), 'tax': FieldInfo(annotation=float, required=False)}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

class apis.toolbox.api_models.ServiceHealth(*, name: str, version: str, status: int, status_message: str, timezone: str, uptime: str)

Bases: BaseModel

Represents the health status of a service.

Attributes:

name (str): The name of the service. version (tuple[int, str]): The version of the service. status (int): The status code indicating the health status. timezone (str): The timezone in which the service is operating. uptime (str): A string representing the uptime of the service.

Attributes:
model_extra

Get extra fields set during validation.

model_fields_set

Returns the set of fields that have been explicitly set on this model instance.

model_computed_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, ComputedFieldInfo]] = {}

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'name': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'status': FieldInfo(annotation=int, required=True), 'status_message': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'timezone': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'uptime': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'version': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True)}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

name: str
status: int
status_message: str
timezone: str
uptime: str
